Reviews.Title: Good Budgt Machine if the Price is Right
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Moore
Reviews.Content: While the listed $394 price tag is not that extreme, take that listed "$204 off" from a 599.99 base price with a grain of salt.Overall the reliability record of Toshiba Satellite machines has been quite solid, ranking alongside Asus and Sony in as the best terms of malfunction rates despite some of the lowest prices, so taken from that aspect this is a great budget machine that won't get too hot or eat too much power.That said, the price is somewhat in line with sale prices you can find of machines one step above this in terms of specs (dual core processor's with 3 gigs of RAM).If you can find it for $329 or less and don't have needs much heavier than web-browsing/word processing/maybe playing (if you purchase a pair of speakers or at least headphones) than this could be the perfect machine for you.At $394 however you can probably do better, and if you want to be able to play games a couple years old, use photoshop, mutlitask, etc. then you are probably best of looking for a machine just a touch more powerful than this.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: andi4music
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 9 year old son for Christmas!!  Got it for $278 at Walmart..Cant beat the price!!  It was ready to go right out of the box. Great for surfing the net gaming and everyday tasks.  Crisp screen quality and DVD playback is great! Good investment for kids without breaking the bank!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Basic System
Reviews.Author: Gaspare Marturano
Reviews.Content: I picked this system as a backup computer to my desktop and to use when I travel. I have to say you get great bang for the buck. It not a light system by any means (heavy...using it on an airplane might be a challenge)but it's fast, and the keyboard is fantastic. I would suggest adding the extra 2GB of ram (comes with 2GB)and bring it to 4GB. The HD TruBrite screen is really nice....Crisp and clean. I purchased the system at Walmart for $278, a steal!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the price
Reviews.Author: Nick "Nick"
Reviews.Content: bought this laptop 6 month ago , it was running very slow from the start, after 3 month it would not load windows anymore, I called Toshiba CS and they agreed to send me a box to ship it to them to have it repaired, apparently it needed a new hard drive and it is a problem they know about ( why not recall them all and fix it?)- if yours turns off all the time on its own you need a new hard drive, it took 10 days to get my laptop back, it was covered under warranty and free of charge but a huge inconvenience- I will not buy Toshiba againETA: Here we are 6 month later and out of warranty- the same hard drive failure as before,I was told "well you are out of the warranty we can change the drive but now you will have to pay around $250 for it" They will replace the TH- the drive is barely 6 month old but the warranty for it was only 30 days!! After a lot of back and forth Toshiba will replace the drive free of charge again for which I am greatful but I am saving up for a new laptop!ETA again:I finally received my laptop back- hard drive repaired but now the fan does not work!! After 2hours on the phone with several "Toshiba representatives". I have to send it in again so they "can get to the root of the problem". No telling how much longer this will take- Toshiba never again!!

Reviews.Title: Tested a variety of Toshibas; All Satellites performed well, but the L455 has the SLOWEST processor for MORE money!
Reviews.Author: Mad Max
Reviews.Content: We tested a dozen Toshiba Satellites, and love them all. The problem with this model is, the processor uses 10-year-old technology. It's the slowest on the market.I see some of the reviewers bought this at Walmart (for $278-$300). I would NOT buy this laptop for that price. I strongly recommend a Toshiba Satellite, but this model was specifically made for Walmart & discount stores, with the cheapest possible chip.The chip used here has a clock speed of 510, which is pathetic (CPUbenchmark-net). For LESS MONEY, you can get a Toshiba Satellite right here on Amazon with clock speeds of 800-1,200. If you've come here looking for a Toshiba Satellite, this is a good company and a good brand, just don't buy the "Walmart version".There are plenty of options right here on Amazon for under $400 (just look at the processor type, and look it up at the CPUbenchmark site - 800-1,000 should be the minimum by today's standards). And, don't think that faster chips means it will cost more. Actually, it may cost less.That said, let me proceed to the review:PRO's:-We tested a dozen models, and except for variations in speed, all the models were great.-Screen is fine - no complaints. (I would not recommend the Toshiba models with the Trubrite screen - models with the TruBrite cost about $100 more & it picks up lots of reflections.)-I'm fairly impressed with the battery. I also have a netbook with a 10 hour battery life, but for a full sized laptop these are great. For normal use (internet, some music, etc) I get 2-3 hours. If I'm just working on data offline, I get 4.5 hours.-Stays very cool (even when playing videos), and the fan rarely kicks on.-It's light weight & durable. My 12-month old will pound on the keys occasionally, and it holds up just fine.-Comes with built-in antivirus software. I recommend also installing Avira, and every computer/laptop you own should be running Hostsman (both are free downloads).CON's:-No built-in camera or mic.-Sound is not great. Most people assume it's cheap speakers, but it's not. Speakers are fine - but the sound driver itself is the problem for some reason. You can uninstall the driver & have Windows install a generic driver that will boost your sound levels by 50% (easier said than done in Windows 7).-This model lacks the numeric keypad on the side. I would not buy a model without the keypad - with page up/page down, and other shortcuts, it's very convenient.Bottom Line: (1) Please be an INFORMED consumer. Don't pay more because you think they're higher quality, but also don't buy the cheapie because you think it's a good deal. (2) Unless you need a super-computer for specialized programming, you should be able to find a Toshiba Satellite with a great processor & all the amenities you need for under $400, right here on Amazon.Hope this helps, and enjoy your new laptop!

Reviews.Title: Terrible Laptop Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: From the first day I got this this thing ran hot. Aside from the overheating it also has random crashes and it is very slow! No one should buy this laptop. Actually you shouldn't even get a toshiba for they are known for overheating constantly.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Defect
Reviews.Author: S. Faubert
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Satellite 15 months ago and have loved it until two weeks ago when the 2 USB ports on the right-hand side came loose and fell inside. I took the computer to a repair shop and was told this is a common issue with Toshiba laptops due to the weld Toshiba uses for the ports; they couldn't repair it but could send it in to Toshiba for repair -- at a cost of $400! I contacted Toshiba and was told that since I was 5 months out of warranty, they could repair it, but it would cost me ... $400! If you go online and search for Toshiba USB Port problems, you will find a slew of people that have experienced the same issue with their Toshiba laptops, even current year models. Save your money and purchase a different brand of laptop.

Reviews.Title: Product has several problems and customer service is the worst I've seen
Reviews.Author: carol1
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Toshiba laptop model LD55 and 1 month later, the keyboard stopped working.  I had to send it in for repairs at Toshiba depot.  4 months after this, the hard disk crashed and the Toshiba repair depot has been holding my laptop without repair because they have a delay in arrival of parts ordered.  I have asked for a refund or replacement with an equivalent computer but all I got after several phone calls, writing Toshiba and loosing approximately 14hrs talking to Toshiba customer reps was an offer of a reconditioned laptop with a 90 day warranty.  I would accept this if the warranty was extended considering the problems I had experienced with the new laptop.  Now I am told again that my laptop part will be late for another 1 month in addition to the 2 months already gone.  I don't know what to do.  Toshiba has got to be the worst laptop company out there.  They are living on past glory.  I will never touch any of their products again!

Reviews.Title: Defective product - Manufacturer warranty a joke
Reviews.Author: PatB
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop for my son on 10/31/2010, about 2 weeks ago while at home during holiday break from college, he opens the computer, turns it on and the screen just goes black. I contacted Toshiba and sent the computer in for repairs per their instructions. Several days later I am contacted by Toshiba and told that the LCD is damaged and this is not covered under their warranty because it is considerded customer damage. My argument was how do you damage a computer simply by opening the case and turning it on? In my estimation this computer is a cheap piece of junk, less than 3 months after purchase it is damaged and the company does not stand behind their 1 yr warranty. Avoid at all cost, I will end up having to replace this computer because of the price it cost to repair it. I will go back to HP, Dell or something else, I will not purchase another Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: It does what it is supposed to do.
Reviews.Author: PuterGeek2 "Angel Fan"
Reviews.Content: Let's start off by saying this is by no means a High End Laptop.  This is a very basic laptop that surfs the net well. It will play youtube videos in HD along with do all you need with facebook, with no problems.  As a BASIC laptop (which is what it is) it gets the job done.  If you can get it cheap, it will do what you need to do on a daily basis.Pros:The screen does an outstanding job of color reproduction and is crystal clear.Runs cool... when the fan does kick on it is whisper silent.Snappy start up, and plows through webpages with ease.Relatively Lightweight.Great Battery Life.Touch pad is very responsive.Cons:No Webcam.The Keyboard looks and feels rather cheesy.Not enough RAM out of the box.USB ports are placed in very odd areas.All in all for the price, you get what you pay for.  Thus the 5 stars.  But don't expect to be playing WOW anytime soon.  This is a BASIC LAPTOP, not one designed to Game, or even Edit Photos or videos.  If you are looking for a Laptop to surf the web and do facebook, this is perfect for you.  I would say it is good for kids, or beginners.

Reviews.Title: Good Machine
Reviews.Author: B. Butler "Cat Lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer 12/10/10 and it is still going strong.  I have a little trouble with one of the USB ports on the right side, but if I jiggle it around a bit it starts working.  I used it for work for about 6 months and it performed wonderfully.  I've been using it lately to buy and sell on e-bay and is doing great for that.  I'm not very computer literate, but I know when something works well for me. I also do a lot of gaming and it works pretty well for that, is a little slow for some games.

Reviews.Title: Not quite worth it
Reviews.Author: william goddard
Reviews.Content: Note: This is a review of this product bought from Wal-Mart, not Amazon.  I had a Toshiba Satellite I bought from Best-Buy in 2003 that I really liked (although overpriced) and so we decided to buy this machine for my wife to use.  We paid about $300 for it and have had it for a year.  Currently, the power cord is not working, and we will need to buy a replacement.Graphics: Acceptable, 15.5" screenHard Drive: Acceptable, 250 GB is plenty of space for a machine in this price rangeSound: Terrible, unless you use headphones.  It's just weak.Processor: Terrible, passmark score of 498: [...]Memory: Acceptable at 2GBThe only reason I gave this machine three stars is the price.  It is almost useless for our noisy household of three children under 5.  I still like Toshiba, but it seems you get what you pay for (almost).  This is essentially a souped up netbook.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't last! Bought one 9/2010, hard drive died today!
Reviews.Author: B.E. "B.E."
Reviews.Content: I bought this one mid-September '10, and it lasted a total of UNDER 13 months. Today the hard drive died. Less than 13 months for hundreds of dollars!Steer right clear of Toshiba notebooks. You'd be courting trouble and wasting money like I did.

Reviews.Title: Bought two of these for $278.00 Xmas 2010
Reviews.Author: Jenny Nicholson "Jason Nicholson"
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I start?? Well, I should have bought the 4 that Walmart had in stock the day I was there. Instead I ONLY bought two of these AMAZING laptops. I am beyond pleased with this purchase. The processor speed is insanely fast! I can run multiple programs that require a heavy load on the AMD chip. I am very very pleased. This computer does EVERYTHING I need it to do instantly. The only problem I have is that I could have bought 4 of these and I didn't. I have one still in the box I am saving for my Daughter who starts college Fall 2012. I will give it to her a week before school starts so she can familiarize herself with it. I will probably pull it out of its new packaging next week. (Feb 1, 2011) to make sure everything works just fine, then I will package it back up and save it for her. The peace of mind I have is that I ONLY paid 278, plus I bought a 3 year warranty from Walmart, that even covers accidental damage. Thats AWESOME!!! Folks you cant go wrong on this computer. If you can pick one up under $350.00 Your getting a STEAL OF A DEAL!!!!J. NicholsonCornelius, Oregon37 years old, with better than average computer knowledge and skills. (but not a pro, just a well informed computer user)Date of this submission 12;41 AM January 27th, 2011

Reviews.Title: Way better than a netbook
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I'm a computer programmer and I paid 360 for this and am quite satisfied.  For me a perfect laptop is one that is not dog slow like a netbook and also one that won't incinerate. :)  This one so far comes out like a champ on both fronts, after about 3 months of moderate use.I've tried netbooks and found them unusable because they are way too slow for my purposes, which includes using some pretty heavy and cumbersome programming IDEs in Java that themselves tend to be dog slow.  This machine is fine with those.  This machine is not super-fast or anything but good enough for those type of things, unlike the netbooks, which are brought to their knees weeping and stuttering by those aforementioned IDEs.  ;)Also the budget factor is a good thing, because it means this machine runs cooler because it only has one processor/core.  I should not need multiple cores for web browsing, email and the like.  I'm guessing the single processor core is why this thing is rarely hot to the touch.For performance, it's nice for you readers to see hard numbers, and Windows 7 makes it easy to get these:  In the Windows 7 STARTMENU+BREAK window mine has these RATINGS: 4.1 for calcs per second, 4.4 for memory ops per second, 3.1 desktop performance for Windows Aero, 4.4 for gaming and 3D business graphics, and 5.6 for disk data transfer rate.I don't mostly care about desktop performance for Windows Aero, though mine has I think all of those features turned on, including right now I'm looking at the transparent glass effect, the start-menu+tab collation of windows, the vastly improved Mac-like taskbar of Windows 7 with pop-up miniature Windows.  All that works fine here, so not sure what that 3.1 is about.But for the rest, those are respectable numbers for this price.  The 4.1 for calcs/second is perhaps the rating most of concern - a core i3 or similar will have about 5.5 here at 32 bits or a core 2 duo desktop of mine has 6.5 at 64 bits - it seems running at 64 bit gets you higher numbers there from my experience, so if you can install 64 bit Windows 7 on here, that number may go up to the 5's and you may be seeing more visible speed with the 64 bit OS, though you may have a couple non-functioning 32-bit software challenges.  (But the 32 bit stuff in theory is supposed to work fine with the Windows 64 bit operating systems.)I'm running this with the Windows 7 32 bit that it came with.  The 4.1 like I say is adequate.The battery life is pretty good too.  I'd say about two hours of steady use, though not necessarily playing movies or something taxing like that - I don't generally do that on here either.  I also don't use it for games, so no idea how it works there, probably acceptable for many though since it runs Aero decently and that requires I think a number of the same primitive support.So I'm extremely happy with this purchase.  A very nice, clean, simple cool business oriented laptop I would call it, for those like me who want respectable performance, but don't need higher levels of performance for the latest games - and notably even on the gaming front I would gather this again would be mostly just fine again!  I think many people out there would benefit from dumping their old laptop clunker and getting this bargain with Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: price leader
Reviews.Author: William J. Getty
Reviews.Content: I love this machine,screen is easy to see for a mature user and the key board is easy to work with. Speed is reasonable and supplied software is all I needed.I use this for internet and word processing so can not say how games would run. I work with older programs so 32 bit was the choice for me. For the money there isn't a laptop on the market I could find that is this useful.

Reviews.Title: needed replacements
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly. Power cord looked like someone tried to eat it. Battery wouldnt hold a charge. Had to update drivers. Which cost more money. I know they are selling used but the least they coukd do is make it worth the purchase by repairing anything and replacing those necesary.

Reviews.Title: Not the best
Reviews.Author: deborah
Reviews.Content: Although thiscomputher is the same style of computher that i have to be an replacemet. It do not have the networking card that is  needed to carry the computher around. I have to keep it in one spot, hooked to an Ethernet cord, And it moves too slow.Not a good buy for me.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: basti
Reviews.Content: this was a good product but every time i try to log in on it it it would not let me log in and send it back thank you so much

Reviews.Title: Lap Top
Reviews.Author: michelle prestage
Reviews.Content: It was great and my child loved just like described and arrived in time for Christmas it was great. Loved it

Reviews.Title: Price comparison
Reviews.Author: max davis
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best laptop's on the market for the price. I purchased it from Fry's Electronics for $299. Dont be heartbroken if you paid more.  Its worth every penny

Reviews.Title: Great PC for price
Reviews.Author: jlk
Reviews.Content: I bought this in March.  I play online games such as WoW and LotRO.  It plays both of them pretty well.  The only issue was if I tried to use ventrilo while playing.  I am very impressed to have a laptop that was $400 compete with my gaming desktop.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT SCREEN & SPEAKER SYSTEM, ACCURATE KEYBOARD & MOUSE PAD , EXCELLENT BANG FOR BUCK !
Reviews.Author: MOM FROM SEATTLE
Reviews.Content: WAS EXTREMELY SURPRISED AT THE SLEEK STYLE AND LIGHT WEIGHT DESIGN ! WINDOWS7 AND 2 GB RAM IS PLENTY FAST , AND THE AWESOME SPEAKERS AND BIG BRIGHT 15.5" SCREEN IS NOW MY PORTABLE HDTV IN MY BEDROOM !! DVD'S AND STREAMING IS SHARP!

Reviews.Title: When am I actually going to get the computer I ordered?
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop in good faith, but when I saw the box on the porch I knew there was a problem; it was way too small. I was keeping track of the shipping so that I could run home really quick and get it off the porch before a thief did, but maybe I needn't have bothered. That's because it was a video camera instead of the computer I ordered. Specifically, it's a Toshiba Camileo x100 video camera, which doesn't even sound remotely like Satellite L455D-S5976 15.6-Inch Laptop . This just happened 10 minutes ago, so if they respond and rush me the computer I ordered overnight maybe I can change my rating, but so far no good at all. I'm going to have to say I don't recommend Toshiba as far as customer service goes anyway. I'd rather base this review on the actual product, but if I don't get it before Christmas this review will stand.

Reviews.Title: Awesome laptop
Reviews.Author: N. Whitley
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop and I am very pleased with it. The screen is nice and big and the speed is great.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Okinawan007
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item thinking that all required software would come product codes with but much to my surprise It did not! Laptop came with lot of pre-installed program that needs product registration codes. I didn't even get a official Windows 7 home edition CD with its registration codes. I wouldn't recommend anyone to purchase a thing from Amazon.com!
